<item>
  <title>Only four hospitals in England hit A&amp;E targets as staff claim exceptional pressures have become &apos;the norm&apos;</title>
  <link>http://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/health-and-families/health-news/only-four-hospitals-in-england-hit-ae-targets-as-staff-claim-exceptional-pressures-have-become-the-a7026961.html</link>
  <description><![CDATA[Shadow Health Secretary claims data from first three months of the year represents 'Black Thursday for the NHS' and that the health service could now be said to be in a state of 'constant crisis']]></description>
  <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:49:00 +0000</pubDate>
  <guid>a7026961</guid>
  <author>Charlie Cooper</author>
  <dc:creator>Charlie Cooper</dc:creator>
  <dc:date>2016-05-12T18:49:00+00:00</dc:date>
  <media:thumbnail url="http://static.independent.co.uk/s3fs-public/styles/feed/public/thumbnails/image/2015/10/31/10/GettyImages-461082856.jpg" type="image/jpeg"/>
  <media:content url="http://static.independent.co.uk/s3fs-public/thumbnails/image/2015/10/31/10/GettyImages-461082856.jpg" type="image/jpeg"/>
  <media:text>Officials insist that no one requiring urgent medical attention will be turned away  (Picture: [copyright])</media:text>
</item>
<item>
  <title>Psychopathy may be a result of &apos;adaptive evolution&apos; rather than a disorder, says inventor of the psychopath test</title>
  <link>http://www.independent.co.uk/news/science/psychopathy-may-be-a-result-of-adaptive-evolution-rather-than-a-disorder-says-inventor-of-the-a7025706.html</link>
  <description><![CDATA[Are the psychopaths among us part of a unique evolutionary strand?]]></description>
  <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:25:43 +0000</pubDate>
  <guid>a7025706</guid>
  <author>Harry Cockburn</author>
  <dc:creator>Harry Cockburn</dc:creator>
  <dc:date>2016-05-12T17:25:43+00:00</dc:date>

  <media:text>Examining the mind  (Picture: [copyright])</media:text>
</item>
<item>
  <title>Cancer scientists find way to halt spread of the disease by making cells &apos;literally get stuck&apos;</title>
  <link>http://www.independent.co.uk/news/science/cancer-cells-metastasis-professor-kay-macleod-chicago-university-prevent-moving-a7026446.html</link>
  <description><![CDATA['Through the microscope, you can see the cell wobbling, trying to move, to put out new protrusions, to migrate, but it can't']]></description>
  <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:02:00 +0000</pubDate>
  <guid>a7026446</guid>
  <author>Ian Johnston</author>
  <dc:creator>Ian Johnston</dc:creator>
  <dc:date>2016-05-12T16:02:00+00:00</dc:date>
  <media:thumbnail url="http://static.independent.co.uk/s3fs-public/styles/feed/public/thumbnails/image/2016/01/10/22/Cancer-Rex.jpg" type="image/jpeg"/>
  <media:content url="http://static.independent.co.uk/s3fs-public/thumbnails/image/2016/01/10/22/Cancer-Rex.jpg" type="image/jpeg"/>
  <media:text>The charity Macmillan Cancer Support has said that from 2017 those who are judged as too ill to work, but who may be capable of work at some time in the future, will lose £30 a week  (Picture: [copyright])</media:text>
</item>
<item>
  <title>More women with breast cancer are choosing useless alternative therapies over chemotherapy, warn scientists</title>
  <link>http://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/health-and-families/health-news/women-with-breast-cancer-warned-to-stop-using-alternative-therapies-instead-of-chemotherapy-a7026331.html</link>
  <description><![CDATA[Researchers believe complementary therapy use in breast cancer sufferers has increased in the last twenty years]]></description>
  <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:58:00 +0000</pubDate>
  <guid>a7026331</guid>
  <author>Siobhan Fenton</author>
  <dc:creator>Siobhan Fenton</dc:creator>
  <dc:date>2016-05-12T15:58:00+00:00</dc:date>
  <media:thumbnail url="http://static.independent.co.uk/s3fs-public/styles/feed/public/thumbnails/image/2015/10/26/16/cancer.jpg" type="image/jpeg"/>
  <media:content url="http://static.independent.co.uk/s3fs-public/thumbnails/image/2015/10/26/16/cancer.jpg" type="image/jpeg"/>
  <media:text>A cancer patient receives chemotherapy  (Picture: [copyright])</media:text>
</item>
<item>
  <title>Making abortion illegal does not reduce number of women having terminations, study concludes</title>
  <link>http://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/health-and-families/health-news/women-in-countries-where-abortion-is-illegal-just-as-likely-to-have-one-as-countries-where-it-is-a7025671.html</link>
  <description><![CDATA[Countries where abortion is illegal have slightly higher abortion rates than countries where the procedures are legal, the research found]]></description>
  <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 11:01:00 +0000</pubDate>
  <guid>a7025671</guid>
  <author>Siobhan Fenton</author>
  <dc:creator>Siobhan Fenton</dc:creator>
  <dc:date>2016-05-12T11:01:00+00:00</dc:date>
  <media:thumbnail url="http://static.independent.co.uk/s3fs-public/styles/feed/public/thumbnails/image/2016/04/08/14/belfast3.jpeg" type="image/jpeg"/>
  <media:content url="http://static.independent.co.uk/s3fs-public/thumbnails/image/2016/04/08/14/belfast3.jpeg" type="image/jpeg"/>
  <media:text>A pro-choice supporter carries a placard which reads 'Abortion is healthcare, it should be free, safe and legal'  (Picture: [copyright])</media:text>
</item>
<item>
  <title>Air pollution in UK &apos;wreaking havoc on human health&apos;, WHO warns</title>
  <link>http://www.independent.co.uk/environment/dozens-of-british-cities-are-breaching-air-pollution-limits-in-public-health-crisis-a7025401.html</link>
  <description><![CDATA[Dozens of British cities – from Brighton, Southend and Leamington Spa to Glasgow, Manchester and Belfast – are breaching safety limits]]></description>
